titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Commission for Relief in Belgium (1940-1945) Records, 1939-1947
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Commission for Relief in Belgium (1940-1945) Records,
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and photographs, relating to efforts to provide civilian relief to Belgium and Luxembourg during World War II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Commission for Relief in Belgium (1940-1945) Records, 1939-1947, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945.
World War, 1939-1945--Belgium.
World War, 1939-1945--Civilian relief.
World War, 1939-1945--Food question.
World War, 1939-1945--Luxembourg.
International relief.
controlaccess.corpname: National Committee on Food for the Small Democracies.

odd.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, minutes of meetings, printed matter and other materials relating to the operations of the Commission for Relief in Belgium. Arranged alphabetically by physical form

Letters sent and received by the C.R.B. Includes correspondence with individuals, groups and organizations, the Belgian Embassy and Consulates in the United States, arranged chronologically and alphabetically by name of correspondent
Correspondence, memoranda, reports, minutes of meetings, printed matter and other materials relating to the operations of the Belgian Relief Fund. Arranged alphabetically by physical form

Correspondence, memoranda, publicity leaflets, reports, printed matter and other materials relating to the operations of the Belgian General Relief Committee (Winterhelp). Arranged alphabeticaly by physical form
Correspondence, reports, memoranda, clippings, printed matter and other materials, collected by the C.R.B. Arranged alphabetically by subject

scopecontent.p: Food map, leaflets, placards and posters issued by the C.R.B.
216 prints in 8 envelopes depicting relief operations of the C.R.B. in Belgium

did.unittitle: Application forms for foreign and domestic relief activities
Directors and members invitations and acceptances
Regulations for the formation of chapters and committees
To Herbert Hoover. "Memorandum of Food Situation and Events Connected Therewith in Belgium, Brussels, 1940 May-July"
To the U.S. Department of State
Guaranty Trust Company of New York
National City Bank of New York
Statement by H. Hoover, "An Experiment in Saving the Lives of 3,000 Destitute Adults and Children in Belgium," 1941 April 1
President's Committee on War Relief Agencies
Visit to Belgium of the CRB Representatives, 1941 January 19-24
Memorandum entitled "Clothing House for Belgium - Plan of Organization," n.d.
Laymens League for Arts and Industries
La Guardia Field cocktail party, 1940 July 16
Village Fair for Refugee Children, 1940 July 9-13

odd.p: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, clippings, printed matter and other materials

did.unittitle: Committee to Defend America by Aiding the Allies
Federal Council of the Churches of Christ in America
Jewish support of Belgian relief operations
National Committee on Food for the Five Small Democracies
Food map illustrating and listing foodstuff exports and imports of various countries, 1938. Prepared by the C.R.B.
Leaflets, placards, and posters issued by the C.R.B., 1940-1941
81 prints depicting officers of the C.R.B. and Belgian Red Cross, and various dignitaries in Belgium, 1940-1941
50 prints depicting preparations of clothing, food, and paperwork before distribution. Includes Belgian adults and children waiting in lines
36 prints depicting distribution of clothing and food to adults and children in Belgium, 1940
27 prints depicting various street scenes in Belgium
7 prints depicting interior scenes illustrating living conditions in Belgium
9 prints depicting posters and publicity placards issued by the C.R.B.
